TopicTitle: How to edit a blog post?

Articles.Content:
(This is about the KSP forum rather than gameplay itself, but didn't see a different forum for questions like this.)

How do I edit a blog post in the KSP forums? (Here's my blog.)

Surely I must be able to, right? After all, if I make a forum post, I can come back to it later and edit (there's an "Edit Post" button under it). But darned if I can figure out how to edit my blog entry, after I've posted it. Is it graven in stone the moment I push the "submit" button?

(Perhaps this is a dumb question and the answer is obvious, but I've been staring and staring at the UI and can't seem to find a way to do this anywhere. It will let me post a comment on my blog post. It will even let me report my own blog post as inappropriate content. But I can't figure out how to edit the blog post itself.)

Or if (against all sanity and reason) for some reason it's not actually possible to edit a blog post: am I using the wrong feature? I'd like to have a place where I can write a persistent entry, that's tied to me, that's not lost in the list of N-hundred-forum-posts, where I can put useful information that I may want to link people to. I assumed that "blog entry" was the right place to do that. Any such repository of posts needs to have the ability to edit the posts, in order for it to be useful. If "blog post" isn't the right place to do that, what should I do?

Any advice appreciated.

Click the little pencil icon to the right of the title.

(Moved to the Kerbal Network)
